disease: Whooping cough due to Bordetella parapertussis with pneumonia

symptoms.name: Cough
symptoms.pattern: progresses from mild to severe hacking cough, potentially with whooping sound; may be worse at night; can last weeks or months

vital_signs.respiratory_rate: increased due to coughing and potential pneumonia

lab_values.IgG and IgA antibodies to PT and FHA: increased levels indicate infection, but may not distinguish between B. pertussis and B. parapertussis

risk_factors: Lack of vaccination or incomplete vaccination series
Teenage and adult years (vaccine immunity wanes)

required: Clinical presentation consistent with whooping cough (coughing spells, potentially with whooping sound)
Laboratory confirmation of Bordetella parapertussis infection (culture, PCR)
supportive: Elevated antibody titers to pertussis toxins

differential_diagnoses: Whooping cough due to Bordetella pertussis
Other respiratory infections (e.g., common cold, influenza)
